actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.
Reported to House from the Committee on Ways and Means with amendment, H. Rept. 95-1093.
Measure called up under motion to suspend rules and pass in House.
Measure passed House, amended, roll call #357 (407-0).

official_title: Resolution expressing the sense of the House with respect to the immediate removal of certain regulations unilaterally put in place by the European Economic Community which have the effect of damaging and interfering with historic and acceptable trade patterns in the United States exports of dried prunes, and efforts made to restrict exports of walnuts to the European Economic Community.

summary.text: (Reported to House from the Committee on Ways and Means with amendment, H. Rept. 95-1093) Declares it the sense of the House of Representatives: (1) that the President should obtain removal of the trade impairments placed on certain United States processed fruits and vegetables by the European Economic Community and should seek agreement with the European Economic Community that similar restrictive measures will not be imposed in the future, and (2) that the European Economic Community should be placed on notice that retaliatory measures will be taken if restrictive import regulations are placed on certain processed fruits and vegetables from the United States.

titles.title: Resolution expressing the sense of the House with respect to the immediate removal of certain regulations unilaterally put in place by the European Economic Community which have the effect of damaging and interfering with historic and acceptable trade patterns in the United States exports of dried prunes, and efforts made to restrict exports of walnuts to the European Economic Community.
